newsitem.title: USA: US spot propane slips on NYMEX losses.
newsitem.headline: US spot propane slips on NYMEX losses.

text.p: U.S. spot propane prices slipped in quiet trade on Tuesday in line with the sharp fall on NYMEX crude oil futures, players said.
The heavies were also weaker to steady from Monday, finding some support from continued petrochemical and other end-use demand.
In the U.S. Gulf Coast, Mont Belvieu, Texas, spot propane fell a half cent to between 35.25 cents and 35.50 cents a gallon. Conway, Kansas, material was a quarter cent down at 36.50/37.00 cents.
Belvieu normal butane was down a half cent although isobutane was steady at 46.25/46.50 cents.
Conway normal sold at 38.25 cents, 0.25 cent below Monday. Isobutane was pegged 46.50/46.75 cents.
-- Laney Salisbury, New York Energy Desk, 1 212 859 1631
